alert.note: Alert for Bee; Live Oak (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 6:21PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Live Oak and northwestern Bee Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Choke Canyon, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Choke Canyon, Pawnee, Nell, Esseville and Whitsett. This includes Interstate 37 between mile markers 74 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
